## Classes

### <a name="numad"></a>`numad`

This class will manage the numad service and associated config.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include numad
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `numad` class:

* [`package_manage`](#-numad--package_manage)
* [`package_ensure`](#-numad--package_ensure)
* [`package_name`](#-numad--package_name)
* [`service_name`](#-numad--service_name)
* [`service_ensure`](#-numad--service_ensure)
* [`service_enable`](#-numad--service_enable)
* [`numad_binary`](#-numad--numad_binary)
* [`numad_arguments`](#-numad--numad_arguments)

##### <a name="-numad--package_manage"></a>`package_manage`

Data type: `Boolean`



Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-numad--package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `'installed'`

##### <a name="-numad--package_name"></a>`package_name`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `'numad'`

##### <a name="-numad--service_name"></a>`service_name`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `'numad.service'`

##### <a name="-numad--service_ensure"></a>`service_ensure`

Data type: `Stdlib::Ensure::Service`



Default value: `'running'`

##### <a name="-numad--service_enable"></a>`service_enable`

Data type: `Boolean`



Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-numad--numad_binary"></a>`numad_binary`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`



Default value: `'/usr/bin/numad'`

##### <a name="-numad--numad_arguments"></a>`numad_arguments`

Data type: `Optional[Array]`



Default value: `undef`
